00004 import os, re, types

00007 # Returns the name of the shared object (i.e. libkdeui.so.4)
00008 # referenced by a libtool archive (like libkdeui.la)
00009 def getSOfromLA(lafile):
00010         contents = open(lafile, 'r').read()
00011         match = re.search("^dlname='([^']*)'$", contents, re.M)
00012         if match: return match.group(1)
00013         return None
00014 
00015 # A helper, needed .. everywhere
00016 def KDEuse(lenv, flags):
00017         if lenv['HELP']: lenv.Exit(0)
00018 
00019         _flags=lenv.make_list(flags)
00020         if 'environ' in _flags:
00021                 ## The scons developers advise against using this but it is mostly innocuous :)
00022                 lenv.AppendUnique( ENV = os.environ )
00023         if not 'lang_qt' in _flags:
00024                 ## Use this define if you are using the kde translation scheme (.po files)
00025                 lenv.Append( CPPFLAGS = '-DQT_NO_TRANSLATION' )
00026         if 'rpath' in _flags:
00027                 ## Use this to set rpath - this may cause trouble if folders are moved (chrpath)
00028                 kdelibpaths=[]
00029                 if lenv['KDELIBPATH'] == lenv['KDELIB']: kdelibpaths = [lenv['KDELIB']]
00030                 else: kdelibpaths = [lenv['KDELIBPATH'],  lenv['KDELIB']]
00031                 lenv.Append( RPATH = [lenv['QTLIBPATH'], lenv['KDEMODULE']]+kdelibpaths )
00032         if 'thread' in _flags:
00033                 ## Uncomment the following if you need threading support
00034                 lenv.KDEaddflags_cxx( ['-DQT_THREAD_SUPPORT', '-D_REENTRANT'] )
00035         if 'fastmoc' in _flags:
00036                 lenv['BKSYS_FASTMOC']=1
00037         if 'dump' in _flags:
00038                 lenv['DUMPCONFIG']=1
00039         if not 'nohelp' in _flags:
00040                 if lenv['_CONFIGURE_'] or lenv['HELP']: lenv.Exit(0)
00041         if not 'nosmart' or not lenv.has_key('nosmart_includes'):
00042                 lenv.AppendUnique(CPPPATH=['#/'])
00043                 lst=[]
00044                 if lenv.has_key('USE_THE_FORCE_LUKE'):
00045                         lst=lenv['USE_THE_FORCE_LUKE']
00046                         lenv.__delitem__('USE_THE_FORCE_LUKE')
00047                 for v in lst: v.execute()
00048         else: lenv['nosmart_includes']=1
00049 
00050         ## To use kdDebug(intvalue)<<"some trace"<<endl; you need to define -DDEBUG
00051         ## it is done in admin/generic.py automatically when you do scons configure debug=1
00052 
00053 def exists(env):
00054         return True

00056 def detect_kde(env):
00057         """ Detect the qt and kde environment using kde-config mostly """
00058         def getpath(varname):
00059                 if not env.has_key('ARGS'): return None
00060                 v=env['ARGS'].get(varname, None)
00061                 if v: v=os.path.abspath(v)
00062                 return v
00063 
00064         def getstr(varname):
00065                 if env.has_key('ARGS'): return env['ARGS'].get(varname, '')
00066                 return ''
00067 
00068         prefix      = getpath('prefix')
00069         execprefix  = getpath('execprefix')
00070         datadir     = getpath('datadir')
00071         libdir      = getpath('libdir')
00072 
00073         kdedir      = getstr('kdedir')
00074         kdeincludes = getpath('kdeincludes')
00075         kdelibs     = getpath('kdelibs')
00076 
00077         qtdir       = getstr('qtdir')
00078         qtincludes  = getpath('qtincludes')
00079         qtlibs      = getpath('qtlibs')
00080         libsuffix   = getstr('libsuffix')
00081 
00082         p=env.pprint
00083 
00084         if libdir: libdir = libdir+libsuffix
00085 
00086         ## Detect the kde libraries
00087         print "Checking for kde-config           : ",
00088         str="which kde-config 2>/dev/null"
00089         if kdedir: str="which %s 2>/dev/null" % (kdedir+'/bin/kde-config')
00090         kde_config = os.popen(str).read().strip()
00091         if len(kde_config):
00092                 p('GREEN', 'kde-config was found as '+kde_config)
00093         else:
00094                 if kdedir: p('RED','kde-config was NOT found in the folder given '+kdedir)
00095                 else: p('RED','kde-config was NOT found in your PATH')
00096                 print "Make sure kde is installed properly"
00097                 print "(missing package kdebase-devel?)"
00098                 env.Exit(1)
00099         if kdedir: env['KDEDIR']=kdedir
00100         else: env['KDEDIR'] = os.popen(kde_config+' -prefix').read().strip()
00101 
00102         print "Checking for kde version          : ",
00103         kde_version = os.popen(kde_config+" --version|grep KDE").read().strip().split()[1]
00104         if int(kde_version[0]) != 3 or int(kde_version[2]) < 2:
00105                 p('RED', kde_version)
00106                 p('RED',"Your kde version can be too old")
00107                 p('RED',"Please make sure kde is at least 3.2")
00108         else:
00109                 p('GREEN',kde_version)
00110 
00111         ## Detect the qt library
00112         print "Checking for the qt library       : ",
00113         if not qtdir: qtdir = os.getenv("QTDIR")
00114         if qtdir:
00115                 p('GREEN',"qt is in "+qtdir)
00116         else:
00117                 try:
00118                         tmplibdir = os.popen(kde_config+' --expandvars --install lib').read().strip()
00119                         libkdeuiSO = env.join(tmplibdir, getSOfromLA(env.join(tmplibdir,'/libkdeui.la')) )
00120                         m = re.search('(.*)/lib' + libsuffix + '/libqt.*', os.popen('ldd ' + libkdeuiSO + ' | grep libqt').read().strip().split()[2])
00121                 except: m=None
00122                 if m:
00123                         qtdir = m.group(1)
00124                         p('YELLOW',"qt was found as "+m.group(1))
00125                 else:
00126                         p('RED','qt was not found')
00127                         p('RED','Please set QTDIR first (/usr/lib/qt3?) or try scons -h for more options')
00128                         env.Exit(1)
00129         env['QTDIR'] = qtdir.strip()
00130 
00131         ## Find the necessary programs uic and moc
00132         print "Checking for uic                  : ",
00133         uic = qtdir + "/bin/uic"
00134         if os.path.isfile(uic):
00135                 p('GREEN',"uic was found as "+uic)
00136         else:
00137                 uic = os.popen("which uic 2>/dev/null").read().strip()
00138                 if len(uic):
00139                         p('YELLOW',"uic was found as "+uic)
00140                 else:
00141                         uic = os.popen("which uic 2>/dev/null").read().strip()
00142                         if len(uic):
00143                                 p('YELLOW',"uic was found as "+uic)
00144                         else:
00145                                 p('RED',"uic was not found - set QTDIR put it in your PATH ?")
00146                                 env.Exit(1)
00147         env['QT_UIC'] = uic
00148 
00149         print "Checking for moc                  : ",
00150         moc = qtdir + "/bin/moc"
00151         if os.path.isfile(moc):
00152                 p('GREEN',"moc was found as "+moc)
00153         else:
00154                 moc = os.popen("which moc 2>/dev/null").read().strip()
00155                 if len(moc):
00156                         p('YELLOW',"moc was found as "+moc)
00157                 elif os.path.isfile("/usr/share/qt3/bin/moc"):
00158                         moc = "/usr/share/qt3/bin/moc"
00159                         p('YELLOW',"moc was found as "+moc)
00160                 else:
00161                         p('RED',"moc was not found - set QTDIR or put it in your PATH ?")
00162                         env.Exit(1)
00163         env['QT_MOC'] = moc
00164 
00165         ## check for the qt and kde includes
00166         print "Checking for the qt includes      : ",
00167         if qtincludes and os.path.isfile(qtincludes + "/qlayout.h"):
00168                 # The user told where to look for and it looks valid
00169                 p('GREEN',"ok "+qtincludes)
00170         else:
00171                 if os.path.isfile(qtdir + "/include/qlayout.h"):
00172                         # Automatic detection
00173                         p('GREEN',"ok "+qtdir+"/include/")
00174                         qtincludes = qtdir + "/include/"
00175                 elif os.path.isfile("/usr/include/qt3/qlayout.h"):
00176                         # Debian probably
00177                         p('YELLOW','the qt headers were found in /usr/include/qt3/')
00178                         qtincludes = "/usr/include/qt3"
00179                 else:
00180                         p('RED',"the qt headers were not found")
00181                         env.Exit(1)
00182 
00183         print "Checking for the kde includes     : ",
00184         kdeprefix = os.popen(kde_config+" --prefix").read().strip()
00185         if not kdeincludes:
00186                 kdeincludes = kdeprefix+"/include/"
00187         if os.path.isfile(kdeincludes + "/klineedit.h"):
00188                 p('GREEN',"ok "+kdeincludes)
00189         else:
00190                 if os.path.isfile(kdeprefix+"/include/kde/klineedit.h"):
00191                         # Debian, Fedora probably
00192                         p('YELLOW',"the kde headers were found in %s/include/kde/"%kdeprefix)
00193                         kdeincludes = kdeprefix + "/include/kde/"
00194                 else:
00195                         p('RED',"The kde includes were NOT found")
00196                         env.Exit(1)
00197 
00198         # kde-config options
00199         kdec_opts = {'KDEBIN'    : 'exe',     'KDEAPPS'      : 'apps',
00200                      'KDEDATA'   : 'data',    'KDEICONS'     : 'icon',
00201                      'KDEMODULE' : 'module',  'KDELOCALE'    : 'locale',
00202                      'KDEKCFG'   : 'kcfg',    'KDEDOC'       : 'html',
00203                      'KDEMENU'   : 'apps',    'KDEXDG'       : 'xdgdata-apps',
00204                      'KDEMIME'   : 'mime',    'KDEXDGDIR'    : 'xdgdata-dirs',
00205                      'KDESERV'   : 'services','KDESERVTYPES' : 'servicetypes',
00206                      'KDEINCLUDE': 'include' }
00207 
00208         if prefix:
00209                 ## use the user-specified prefix
00210                 if not execprefix: execprefix=prefix
00211                 if not datadir: datadir=env.join(prefix,'share')
00212                 if not libdir: libdir=env.join(execprefix, "lib"+libsuffix)
00213 
00214                 subst_vars = lambda x: x.replace('${exec_prefix}', execprefix)\
00215                                 .replace('${datadir}', datadir)\
00216                                 .replace('${libdir}', libdir)\
00217                                 .replace('${prefix}', prefix)
00218                 debian_fix = lambda x: x.replace('/usr/share', '${datadir}')
00219                 env['PREFIX'] = prefix
00220                 env['KDELIB'] = libdir
00221                 for (var, option) in kdec_opts.items():
00222                         dir = os.popen(kde_config+' --install ' + option).read().strip()
00223                         if var == 'KDEDOC': dir = debian_fix(dir)
00224                         env[var] = subst_vars(dir)
00225 
00226         else:
00227                 env['PREFIX'] = os.popen(kde_config+' --expandvars --prefix').read().strip()
00228                 env['KDELIB'] = os.popen(kde_config+' --expandvars --install lib').read().strip()
00229                 for (var, option) in kdec_opts.items():
00230                         dir = os.popen(kde_config+' --expandvars --install ' + option).read().strip()
00231                         env[var] = dir
00232 
00233         env['QTPLUGINS']=os.popen(kde_config+' --expandvars --install qtplugins').read().strip()
00234 
00235         ## kde libs and includes
00236         env['KDEINCLUDEPATH']=kdeincludes
00237         if not kdelibs:
00238                 kdelibs=os.popen(kde_config+' --expandvars --install lib').read().strip()
00239         env['KDELIBPATH']=kdelibs
00240 
00241         ## qt libs and includes
00242         env['QTINCLUDEPATH']=qtincludes
00243         if not qtlibs:
00244                 qtlibs=qtdir+"/lib"+libsuffix
00245         env['QTLIBPATH']=qtlibs

00247 def generate(env):
00248         """ Set up the qt and kde environment and builders - the moc part is difficult to understand """
00249 
00250         # attach this function immediately
00251         SConsEnvironment.KDEuse=KDEuse
00252 
00253         if env['HELP']:
00254                 p=env.pprint
00255                 p('BOLD','*** KDE options ***')
00256                 p('BOLD','--------------------')
00257                 p('BOLD','* prefix     ','base install path,         ie: /usr/local')
00258                 p('BOLD','* execprefix ','install path for binaries, ie: /usr/bin')
00259                 p('BOLD','* datadir    ','install path for the data, ie: /usr/local/share')
00260                 p('BOLD','* libdir     ','install path for the libs, ie: /usr/lib')
00261 
00262                 p('BOLD','* qtdir      ','base of the kde libraries')
00263                 p('BOLD','* kdedir     ','base of the qt libraries')
00264 
00265                 p('BOLD','* libsuffix  ','suffix of libraries on amd64, ie: 64, 32')
00266                 p('BOLD','* kdeincludes','kde includes path (/usr/include/kde on debian, ..)')
00267                 p('BOLD','* qtincludes ','qt includes path (/usr/include/qt on debian, ..)')
00268                 p('BOLD','* kdelibs    ','kde libraries path, for linking the programs')
00269                 p('BOLD','* qtlibs     ','qt libraries path, for linking the program')
00270 
00271                 p('BOLD','* scons configure libdir=/usr/local/lib qtincludes=/usr/include/qt\n')
00272                 return

00279         def reldir(dir):
00280                 ndir    = SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir(dir).srcnode().abspath
00281                 rootdir = SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir('#').abspath
00282                 return ndir.replace(rootdir, '').lstrip('/')
00283 
00284         def relfile(file):
00285                 nfile   = SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.File(file).srcnode().abspath
00286                 rootdir = SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir('#').abspath
00287                 return nfile.replace(rootdir, '').lstrip('/')

00323         def getInstDirForResType(lenv,restype):
00324                 if len(restype) == 0 or not lenv.has_key(restype):
00325                         lenv.pprint('RED',"unknown resource type "+restype)
00326                         lenv.Exit(1)
00327                 else: instdir = lenv[restype]
00328 
00329                 if env['ARGS'] and env['ARGS'].has_key('prefix'):
00330                         instdir = instdir.replace(lenv['PREFIX'], env['ARGS']['prefix'])
00331                 return instdir
00332 
00333         # reconfigure when things are missing
00334         if not env['HELP'] and (env['_CONFIGURE_'] or not env.has_key('QTDIR') or not env.has_key('KDEDIR')):
00335                 detect_kde(env)
00336                 opts.Save(cachefile, env)

00340                         LIBPATH = [env['KDELIBPATH'], env['QTLIBPATH'] ])

00348         ## ui file processing
00349         def uic_processing(target, source, env):
00350                 inc_kde  ='#include <klocale.h>\n#include <kdialog.h>\n'
00351                 inc_moc  ='#include "%s"\n' % target[2].name
00352                 comp_h   ='$QT_UIC -L $QTPLUGINS -nounload -o %s %s' % (target[0].path, source[0].path)
00353                 comp_c   ='$QT_UIC -L $QTPLUGINS -nounload -tr tr2i18n -impl %s %s' % (target[0].path, source[0].path)
00354                 comp_moc ='$QT_MOC -o %s %s' % (target[2].path, target[0].path)
00355                 if env.Execute(comp_h): return ret
00356                 dest = open( target[1].path, "w" )
00357                 dest.write(inc_kde)
00358                 dest.close()
00359                 if env.Execute( comp_c+" >> "+target[1].path ): return ret
00360                 dest = open( target[1].path, "a" )
00361                 dest.write(inc_moc)
00362                 dest.close()
00363                 ret = env.Execute( comp_moc )
00364                 return ret
00365         def uicEmitter(target, source, env):
00366                 adjustixes = SCons.Util.adjustixes
00367                 bs = SCons.Util.splitext(str(source[0].name))[0]
00368                 bs = env.join(str(target[0].get_dir()),bs)
00369                 target.append(bs+'.cpp')
00370                 target.append(bs+'.moc')
00371                 return target, source
00372         env['BUILDERS']['Uic']=Builder(action=uic_processing,emitter=uicEmitter,suffix='.h',src_suffix='.ui')

00374         def kcfg_buildit(target, source, env):
00375                 comp='kconfig_compiler -d%s %s %s' % (str(source[0].get_dir()), source[1].path, source[0].path)
00376                 return env.Execute(comp)
00377         def kcfg_stringit(target, source, env):
00378                 print "processing %s to get %s and %s" % (source[0].name, target[0].name, target[1].name)
00379         def kcfgEmitter(target, source, env):
00380                 adjustixes = SCons.Util.adjustixes
00381                 file=str(source[0].srcnode().name)
00382                 bs = SCons.Util.splitext(str(source[0].name))[0]
00383                 bs = env.join(str(target[0].get_dir()),bs)
00384                 # .h file is already there
00385                 target.append( bs+'.cpp' )
00386                 
00387                 content=source[0].srcnode().get_contents()
00388 
00389                 kcfgfilename=""
00390                 kcfgFileDeclRx = re.compile("[fF]ile\s*=\s*(.+)\s*")
00391                 match = kcfgFileDeclRx.search(content)
00392                 if match: kcfgfilename = match.group(1).strip()
00393 
00394                 if not kcfgfilename:
00395                         env.pprint('RED','invalid kcfgc file '+source[0].srcnode().abspath)
00396                         env.Exit(1)
00397                 source.append( env.join( str(source[0].get_dir()), kcfgfilename) )
00398                 return target, source
00399 
00400         env['BUILDERS']['Kcfg']=Builder(action=env.Action(kcfg_buildit, kcfg_stringit),
00401                         emitter=kcfgEmitter, suffix='.h', src_suffix='.kcfgc')
00402         
00403         ## MOC processing
00404         env['BUILDERS']['Moc']=Builder(action='$QT_MOC -o $TARGET $SOURCE',suffix='.moc',src_suffix='.h')
00405         env['BUILDERS']['Moccpp']=Builder(action='$QT_MOC -o $TARGET $SOURCE',suffix='_moc.cpp',src_suffix='.h')
00406         env['BUILDERS']['Moc2']=Builder(action='$QT_MOC -o $TARGET $SOURCE',suffix='.moc',src_suffix='.cpp')
00407 
00408         ## KIDL file
00409         env['BUILDERS']['Kidl']=Builder(action= 'dcopidl $SOURCE > $TARGET || (rm -f $TARGET ; false)',
00410                         suffix='.kidl', src_suffix='.h')
00411         ## DCOP
00412         env['BUILDERS']['Dcop']=Builder(action='dcopidl2cpp --c++-suffix cpp --no-signals --no-stub $SOURCE',
00413                         suffix='_skel.cpp', src_suffix='.kidl')
00414         ## STUB
00415         env['BUILDERS']['Stub']=Builder(action= 'dcopidl2cpp --c++-suffix cpp --no-signals --no-skel $SOURCE',
00416                         suffix='_stub.cpp', src_suffix='.kidl')
00417         ## DOCUMENTATION
00418         env['BUILDERS']['Meinproc']=Builder(action='cd $TARGET.dir && $MEINPROC --check --cache $TARGET.name $SOURCE.name',
00419                         suffix='.cache.bz2')
00420         ## TRANSLATIONS
00421         env['BUILDERS']['Transfiles']=Builder(action='$MSGFMT $SOURCE -o $TARGET',suffix='.gmo',src_suffix='.po')

00423         ## Handy helpers for building kde programs
00424         ## You should not have to modify them ..
00425 
00426         ui_ext = [".ui"]
00427         kcfg_ext = ['.kcfgc']
00428         header_ext = [".h", ".hxx", ".hpp", ".hh"]
00429         cpp_ext = [".cpp", ".cxx", ".cc"]
00430         skel_ext = [".skel", ".SKEL"]
00431         stub_ext = [".stub", ".STUB"]

00433         def KDEfiles(lenv, target, source):
00434                 """ Returns a list of files for scons (handles kde tricks like .skel) 
00435                 It also makes custom checks against double includes like : ['file.ui', 'file.cpp']
00436                 (file.cpp is already included because of file.ui) """
00437 
00438                 q_object_search = re.compile(r'[^A-Za-z0-9]Q_OBJECT[^A-Za-z0-9]')
00439                 def scan_moc(cppfile):
00440                         addfile=None
00441 
00442                         # try to find the header
00443                         orifile=cppfile.srcnode().name
00444                         bs=SCons.Util.splitext(orifile)[0]
00445 
00446                         h_file=''
00447                         dir=cppfile.dir
00448                         for n_h_ext in header_ext:
00449                                 afile=dir.File(bs+n_h_ext)
00450                                 if afile.rexists():
00451                                         #h_ext=n_h_ext
00452                                         h_file=afile
00453                                         break
00454                         # We have the header corresponding to the cpp file
00455                         if h_file:
00456                                 h_contents = h_file.get_contents()
00457                                 if q_object_search.search(h_contents):
00458                                         # we know now there is Q_OBJECT macro
00459                                         reg = '\n\s*#include\s*("|<)'+str(bs)+'.moc("|>)'
00460                                         meta_object_search = re.compile(reg)
00461                                         #cpp_contents = open(file_cpp, 'rb').read()
00462                                         cpp_contents=cppfile.get_contents()
00463                                         if meta_object_search.search(cpp_contents):
00464                                                 lenv.Moc(h_file)
00465                                         else:
00466                                                 lenv.Moccpp(h_file)
00467                                                 addfile=bs+'_moc.cpp'
00468                                                 print "WARNING: moc.cpp for "+h_file.name+" consider using #include <file.moc> instead"
00469                         return addfile
00470 
00471                 src=[]
00472                 ui_files=[]
00473                 kcfg_files=[]
00474                 other_files=[]
00475                 kidl=[]
00476 
00477                 source_=lenv.make_list(source)
00478 
00479                 # For each file, check wether it is a dcop file or not, and create the complete list of sources
00480                 for file in source_:
00481 
00482                         sfile=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.File(str(file)) # why str(file) ? because ordinal not in range issues
00483                         bs  = SCons.Util.splitext(file)[0]
00484                         ext = SCons.Util.splitext(file)[1]
00485                         if ext in skel_ext:
00486                                 if not bs in kidl:
00487                                         kidl.append(bs)
00488                                 lenv.Dcop(bs+'.kidl')
00489                                 src.append(bs+'_skel.cpp')
00490                         elif ext in stub_ext:
00491                                 if not bs in kidl:
00492                                         kidl.append(bs)
00493                                 lenv.Stub(bs+'.kidl')
00494                                 src.append(bs+'_stub.cpp')
00495                         elif ext == ".moch":
00496                                 lenv.Moccpp(bs+'.h')
00497                                 src.append(bs+'_moc.cpp')
00498                         elif ext in cpp_ext:
00499                                 src.append(file)
00500                                 if not env.has_key('NOMOCFILE'):
00501                                         ret = scan_moc(sfile)
00502                                         if ret: src.append( sfile.dir.File(ret) )
00503                         elif ext in ui_ext:
00504                                 lenv.Uic(file)
00505                                 src.append(bs+'.cpp')
00506                         elif ext in kcfg_ext:
00507                                 name=SCons.Util.splitext(sfile.name)[0]
00508                                 hfile=lenv.Kcfg(file)
00509                                 cppkcfgfile=sfile.dir.File(bs+'.cpp')
00510                                 src.append(bs+'.cpp')
00511                         else:
00512                                 src.append(file)
00513 
00514                 for base in kidl: lenv.Kidl(base+'.h')
00515                 
00516                 # Now check against typical newbie errors
00517                 for file in ui_files:
00518                         for ofile in other_files:
00519                                 if ofile == file:
00520                                         env.pprint('RED',"WARNING: You have included %s.ui and another file of the same prefix"%file)
00521                                         print "Files generated by uic (file.h, file.cpp must not be included"
00522                 for file in kcfg_files:
00523                         for ofile in other_files:
00524                                 if ofile == file:
00525                                         env.pprint('RED',"WARNING: You have included %s.kcfg and another file of the same prefix"%file)
00526                                         print "Files generated by kconfig_compiler (settings.h, settings.cpp) must not be included"
00527                 return src
00528 
00529 
00530         """ In the future, these functions will contain the code that will dump the
00531         configuration for re-use from an IDE """
00532         def KDEinstall(lenv, restype, subdir, files, perms=None):
00533                 if env.has_key('DUMPCONFIG'):
00534                         ret= "<install type=\"%s\" subdir=\"%s\">\n" % (restype, subdir)
00535                         for i in lenv.make_list(files):
00536                                 ret += "    <file name=\"%s\"/>\n" % (relfile(i))
00537                         ret += "</install>\n"
00538                         lenv.add_dump(ret)
00539                         return None
00540 
00541                 if not env['_INSTALL_']: return None
00542                 dir = getInstDirForResType(lenv, restype)
00543 
00544                 p=None
00545                 if not perms:
00546                         if restype=='KDEBIN': p=0755
00547                 else: p=perms
00548                 install_list = lenv.bksys_install(lenv.join(dir, subdir), files, perms=p)
00549                 return install_list
00550 
00551         def KDEinstallas(lenv, restype, destfile, file):
00552                 if not env['_INSTALL_']: return
00553                 dir = getInstDirForResType(lenv, restype)
00554                 install_list = lenv.InstallAs(lenv.join(dir, destfile), file)
00555                 env.Alias('install', install_list)
00556                 return install_list
00557 
00558         def KDEprogram(lenv, target, source, 
00559                         includes='', localshlibs='', globallibs='', globalcxxflags=''):
00560                 """ Makes a kde program 
00561                 The program is installed except if one sets env['NOAUTOINSTALL'] """
00562                 src = KDEfiles(lenv, target, source)
00563                 program_list = lenv.Program(target, src)
00564 
00565                 # we link the program against a shared library done locally, add the dependency
00566                 if not lenv.has_key('nosmart_includes'):
00567                         lenv.AppendUnique(CPPPATH=['./'])
00568                 if len(localshlibs)>0:
00569                         lst=lenv.make_list(localshlibs)
00570                         lenv.link_local_shlib(lst)
00571                         lenv.Depends( program_list, lst )
00572                         
00573                 if len(includes)>0:       lenv.KDEaddpaths_includes(includes)
00574                 if len(globallibs)>0:     lenv.KDEaddlibs(globallibs)
00575                 if len(globalcxxflags)>0: lenv.KDEaddflags_cxx(globalcxxflags)
00576                 
00577                 if not lenv.has_key('NOAUTOINSTALL'):
00578                         KDEinstall(lenv, 'KDEBIN', '', target)
00579                 return program_list
00580 
00581         def KDEshlib(lenv, target, source, kdelib=0, libprefix='lib', 
00582                         includes='', localshlibs='', globallibs='', globalcxxflags='', vnum=''):
00583                 """ Makes a shared library for kde (.la file for klibloader)
00584                 The library is installed except if one sets env['NOAUTOINSTALL'] """
00585                 src = KDEfiles(lenv, target, source)
00586 
00587                 if not lenv.has_key('nosmart_includes'):
00588                         lenv.AppendUnique(CPPPATH=['./'])
00589                 # we link the program against a shared library done locally, add the dependency
00590                 lst=[]
00591                 if len(localshlibs)>0:
00592                         lst=lenv.make_list(localshlibs)
00593                         lenv.link_local_shlib(lst)
00594                 if len(includes)>0:       lenv.KDEaddpaths_includes(includes)
00595                 if len(globallibs)>0:     lenv.KDEaddlibs(globallibs)
00596                 if len(globalcxxflags)>0: lenv.KDEaddflags_cxx(globalcxxflags)
00597 
00598                 restype='KDEMODULE'
00599                 if kdelib==1: restype='KDELIB'
00600 
00601                 library_list = lenv.bksys_shlib(target, src, getInstDirForResType(lenv, restype), libprefix, vnum)
00602                 if len(lst)>0: lenv.Depends( library_list, lst )
00603 
00604                 return library_list
00605 
00606         def KDEstaticlib(lenv, target, source):
00607                 """ Makes a static library for kde - in practice you should not use static libraries 
00608                 1. they take more memory than shared ones
00609                 2. makefile.am needed it because of limitations
00610                 (cannot handle sources in separate folders - takes extra processing) """
00611                 if not lenv.has_key('nosmart_includes'): lenv.AppendUnique(CPPPATH=['./'])
00612                 src=KDEfiles(lenv, target, source)
00613                 return lenv.StaticLibrary(target, src)
00614                 # do not install static libraries by default
00615 
00616         def KDEaddflags_cxx(lenv, fl):
00617                 """ Compilation flags for C++ programs """
00618                 lenv.AppendUnique(CXXFLAGS = lenv.make_list(fl))
00619         
00620         def KDEaddflags_c(lenv, fl):
00621                 """ Compilation flags for C programs """
00622                 lenv.AppendUnique(CFLAGS = lenv.make_list(fl))
00623 
00624         def KDEaddflags_link(lenv, fl):
00625                 """ Add link flags - Use this if KDEaddlibs below is not enough """
00626                 lenv.PrependUnique(LINKFLAGS = lenv.make_list(fl))
00627 
00628         def KDEaddlibs(lenv, libs):
00629                 """ Helper function """
00630                 lenv.AppendUnique(LIBS = lenv.make_list(libs))
00631 
00632         def KDEaddpaths_includes(lenv, paths):
00633                 """ Add new include paths """
00634                 lenv.AppendUnique(CPPPATH = lenv.make_list(paths))
00635 
00636         def KDEaddpaths_libs(lenv, paths):
00637                 """ Add paths to libraries """
00638                 lenv.PrependUnique(LIBPATH = lenv.make_list(paths))

00640         def KDElang(lenv, folder, appname):
00641                 """ Process translations (.po files) in a po/ dir """
00642                 import glob
00643                 dir=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir(folder).srcnode()
00644                 fld=dir.srcnode()
00645                 tmptransfiles = glob.glob(str(fld)+'/*.po')
00646 
00647                 if lenv.has_key('DUMPCONFIG'):
00648                         lenv.add_dump( "<podir dir=\"%s\" name=\"%s\"/>\n" % (reldir(dir), appname) )
00649                         return
00650 
00651                 transfiles=[]
00652                 if lenv.has_key('_BUILDDIR_'):
00653                         bdir=lenv['_BUILDDIR_']
00654                         for pof in lenv.make_list(tmptransfiles):
00655                                 # ITA
00656                                 d=relfile(pof)
00657                                 d2=d.replace(bdir,'').lstrip('/')
00658                                 d3=lenv.join(bdir, d2)
00659                                 #print d2
00660                                 #print d3
00661                                 transfiles.append( lenv.join('#', bdir, d2) )
00662                 else: transfiles=tmptransfiles
00663 
00664                 languages=None
00665                 if lenv['ARGS'] and lenv['ARGS'].has_key('languages'):
00666                         languages=lenv.make_list(lenv['ARGS']['languages'])
00667                 mydir=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir('.')
00668                 for f in transfiles:
00669                         #fname=f.replace(mydir.abspath, '')
00670                         fname=f
00671                         file=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.File(fname)
00672                         country = SCons.Util.splitext(file.name)[0]
00673                         if not languages or country in languages:
00674                                 result = lenv.Transfiles(file)
00675                                 dir=lenv.join( getInstDirForResType(lenv, 'KDELOCALE'), country)
00676                                 lenv.bksys_install(lenv.join(dir, 'LC_MESSAGES'), result, destfile=appname+'.mo')

00678         def KDEicon(lenv, icname='*', path='./', restype='KDEICONS', subdir=''):
00679                 """Contributed by: "Andrey Golovizin" <grooz()gorodok()net>
00680                 modified by "Martin Ellis" <m.a.ellis()ncl()ac()uk>
00681 
00682                 Installs icons with filenames such as cr22-action-frame.png into 
00683                 KDE icon hierachy with names like icons/crystalsvg/22x22/actions/frame.png.
00684                 
00685                 Global KDE icons can be installed simply using env.KDEicon('name').
00686                 The second parameter, path, is optional, and specifies the icons
00687                 location in the source, relative to the SConscript file.
00688 
00689                 To install icons that need to go under an applications directory (to
00690                 avoid name conflicts, for example), use e.g.
00691                 env.KDEicon('name', './', 'KDEDATA', 'appname/icons')"""
00692 
00693                 if lenv.has_key('DUMPCONFIG'):
00694                         lenv.add_dump( "<icondir>\n" )
00695                         lenv.add_dump( "    <icondirent dir=\"%s\" subdir=\"%s\"/>\n" % (reldir(path), subdir) )
00696                         lenv.add_dump( "</icondir>\n" )
00697                         return
00698 
00699                 type_dic = { 'action':'actions', 'app':'apps', 'device':'devices',
00700                         'filesys':'filesystems', 'mime':'mimetypes' } 
00701                 dir_dic = {
00702                 'los'  :'locolor/16x16', 'lom'  :'locolor/32x32',
00703                 'him'  :'hicolor/32x32', 'hil'  :'hicolor/48x48',
00704                 'lo16' :'locolor/16x16', 'lo22' :'locolor/22x22', 'lo32' :'locolor/32x32',
00705                 'hi16' :'hicolor/16x16', 'hi22' :'hicolor/22x22', 'hi32' :'hicolor/32x32',
00706                 'hi48' :'hicolor/48x48', 'hi64' :'hicolor/64x64', 'hi128':'hicolor/128x128',
00707                 'hisc' :'hicolor/scalable',
00708                 'cr16' :'crystalsvg/16x16', 'cr22' :'crystalsvg/22x22', 'cr32' :'crystalsvg/32x32',
00709                 'cr48' :'crystalsvg/48x48', 'cr64' :'crystalsvg/64x64', 'cr128':'crystalsvg/128x128',
00710                 'crsc' :'crystalsvg/scalable'
00711                 }
00712 
00713                 iconfiles = []
00714                 dir=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir(path).srcnode()
00715                 mydir=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir('.')
00716                 import glob
00717                 for ext in ['png', 'xpm', 'mng', 'svg', 'svgz']:
00718                         files = glob.glob(str(dir)+'/'+'*-*-%s.%s' % (icname, ext))
00719                         for file in files:
00720                                 iconfiles.append( file.replace(mydir.abspath, '') )
00721                 for iconfile in iconfiles:
00722                         lst = iconfile.split('/')
00723                         filename = lst[ len(lst) - 1 ]
00724                         tmp = filename.split('-')
00725                         if len(tmp)!=3:
00726                                 env.pprint('RED','WARNING: icon filename has unknown format: '+iconfile)
00727                                 continue
00728                         [icon_dir, icon_type, icon_filename]=tmp
00729                         try:
00730                                 basedir=getInstDirForResType(lenv, restype)
00731                                 destdir = '%s/%s/%s/%s/' % (basedir, subdir, dir_dic[icon_dir], type_dic[icon_type])
00732                         except KeyError:
00733                                 env.pprint('RED','WARNING: unknown icon type: '+iconfile)
00734                                 continue
00735                         lenv.bksys_install(destdir, iconfile, icon_filename)
00736 
00737         ## This function uses env imported above - WARNING ugly code, i will have to rewrite (ITA)
00738         def docfolder(lenv, folder, lang, destination=""):
00739                 # folder is the folder to process
00740                 # lang is the language
00741                 # destination is the subdirectory in KDEDOC (appname)
00742                 import glob
00743                 docfiles=[]
00744                 dir=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir(folder).srcnode()
00745                 mydir=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.Dir('.')
00746                 dirpath=mydir.srcnode().abspath
00747                 docg = glob.glob(str(dir)+"/???*.*") # file files that are at least 4 chars wide :)
00748                 for file in docg:
00749                         f = file.replace(dirpath, '')
00750                         docfiles.append(f)
00751 
00752                 if lenv.has_key('DUMPCONFIG'):
00753                         lenv.add_dump( "<docdir name=\"%s\">\n" % destination)
00754                         lenv.add_dump( "    <docdirent lang=\"%s\" dir=\"%s\"/>\n" % (lang, reldir(dir)) )
00755                         lenv.add_dump( "</docdir>\n" )
00756                         return
00757 
00758                 # warn about errors
00759                 #if len(lang) != 2:
00760                 #       print "error, lang must be a two-letter string, like 'en'"
00761 
00762                 # when the destination is not given, use the folder
00763                 if len(destination) == 0: destination=folder
00764                 docbook_list = []
00765 
00766                 bdir='.'
00767                 if lenv.has_key('_BUILDDIR_'): bdir = lenv['_BUILDDIR_']
00768                 for file in docfiles:
00769                         # do not process folders
00770                         #if not os.path.isfile( lenv.join('.', file) ): continue
00771 
00772                         # build a node representing the file in the build directory to force symlinking
00773                         nodefile=relfile( lenv.join(mydir.abspath, file) )
00774                         #print nodefile
00775                         #nodefile=relfile( lenv.join(self.dirprefix, file) )
00776                         nodefile=SCons.Node.FS.default_fs.File( lenv.join('#', bdir, nodefile) )
00777                         #print nodefile.abspath
00778 
00779                         # do not process the cache file
00780                         if file == 'index.cache.bz2': continue
00781                         # ignore invalid files (TODO??)
00782                         if len( SCons.Util.splitext( file ) ) <= 1: continue
00783                         ext = SCons.Util.splitext( file )[1]
00784 
00785                         # install picture files
00786                         if ext in ['.jpeg', '.jpg', '.png']: lenv.KDEinstall('KDEDOC', lenv.join(lang,destination), nodefile.abspath)
00787                         # docbook files are processed by meinproc
00788                         if ext != '.docbook': continue
00789                         
00790                         docbook_list.append( nodefile )
00791                         lenv.KDEinstall('KDEDOC', lenv.join(lang,destination), nodefile.abspath)
00792 
00793                 # Now process the index.docbook files ..
00794                 if len(docbook_list) == 0: return
00795 
00796                 index=''
00797                 cache=''
00798                 for file in docbook_list:
00799                         if file.name=='index.docbook':
00800                                 index=file
00801                                 cache=file.dir.File('index.cache.bz2')
00802 
00803                 if not index:
00804                         print "BUG in docfolder: no index.docbook but docbook files found"
00805                         lenv.Exit(1)
00806 
00807                 for file in docbook_list:
00808                         # make the cache.bz2 file depend on all .docbook files in the same dir
00809                         lenv.Depends( cache, file )
00810 
00811                 lenv.Meinproc( cache, index )
00812                 lenv.KDEinstall( 'KDEDOC', lenv.join(lang,destination), cache )
00813                 
00814                 if env['_INSTALL_']:
00815                         dir=lenv.join(lenv.getInstDirForResType('KDEDOC'), lang, destination)
00816                         comp='mkdir -p %s && cd %s && rm -f common && ln -s ../common common' % (dir, dir)
00817                         lenv.Execute(comp)
00818                         
00819                         #self.env.AddPostAction(lenv.join(dir, 'common'), self.env.Chmod(ins, self.perms))
00820                         # TODO add post action of cache (index.cache.bz2)
00821 
00822         #valid_targets = "program shlib kioslave staticlib".split()
00823         import generic
00824         class kobject(generic.genobj):
00825                 def __init__(self, val, senv=None):
00826                         if senv: generic.genobj.__init__(self, val, senv)
00827                         else: generic.genobj.__init__(self, val, env)
00828                         self.iskdelib=0
00829                 def it_is_a_kdelib(self): self.iskdelib=1
00830                 def execute(self):
00831                         if self.self.executed: return
00832                         if self.self.orenv.has_key('DUMPCONFIG'):
00833                                 self.self.executed=1
00834                                 self.xml()
00835                                 return
00836                         if (self.self.type=='shlib' or self.self.type=='kioslave'):
00837                                 install_dir = 'KDEMODULE'
00838                                 if self.iskdelib==1: install_dir = 'KDELIB'
00839                                 self.self.instdir=getInstDirForResType(self.self.orenv, install_dir)
00840                         elif self.self.type=='program':
00841                                 self.self.instdir=getInstDirForResType(self.self.orenv, 'KDEBIN')
00842                                 self.self.perms=0755
00843 
00844                         # ITA
00845                         #print self.source
00846                         #print "hallo"
00847                         self.self.p_localsource=KDEfiles(env, self.self.joinpath(self.self.target), self.self.joinpath(self.self.source))
00848                         # ITA
00849                         #print self.p_localsource
00850                         generic.genobj.execute(self)
00851 
00852                 def xml(self):
00853                         dirprefix = reldir('.')
00854                         if not dirprefix: dirprefix=self.self.dirprefix
00855                         ret='<compile type="%s" dirprefix="%s" target="%s" cxxflags="%s" cflags="%s" includes="%s" linkflags="%s" libpaths="%s" libs="%s" vnum="%s" iskdelib="%s" libprefix="%s">\n' % (self.self.type, dirprefix, self.self.target, self.self.cxxflags, self.self.cflags, self.self.includes, self.self.linkflags, self.self.libpaths, self.self.libs, self.self.vnum, self.iskdelib, self.self.libprefix)
00856                         if self.self.source:
00857                                 for i in self.self.orenv.make_list(self.self.source): ret+='    <source file="%s"/>\n' % i
00858                         ret+="</compile>\n"
00859                         self.self.orenv.add_dump(ret)
00860
